steps.action: Check System Logs for Detailed Information
steps.description: Reviewing system logs can reveal hidden issues or anomalies that weren't detected by initial checks. Use journalctl to examine systemd logs and systemctl to check service statuses.
Ensure all critical services are running and there are no failed services that could be causing indirect issues.
High CPU or memory usage might not crash the server but could cause analysis failures. Monitor resource usage to identify spikes or unusual patterns.
Check Nginx or Apache logs for errors related to the analysis tool or service. Configuration issues might prevent proper logging or analysis.
A reboot can resolve transient issues not evident in logs. This is particularly relevant for Dell PowerEdge servers as per the web results.
If logs and configurations are fine, disk issues might be the culprit. Use disk diagnostic tools to check for hardware problems.
